% ----------------------------------------------------------------------
\section*{Student Proof \proof}\vspace{-2ex}
Solution by group \group: \namea, \matnoa{} and \nameb, \matnob
\bigskip
% ----------------------------------------------------------------------
% ----------------------------------------------------------------------
%  Your solution here
% ----------------------------------------------------------------------
\problem{~\par
  \(\Dot{V}(x)=\frac{\partial{V}}{\partial{x}}f(x)-k\frac{\partial{V}}{\partial{x}}G(x)R^{-1}(x)G^T(x)(\frac{\partial{V}}{\partial{x}})^T\)~\par
  Substitute for \(\frac{\partial{V}}{\partial{x}}f(x)\) using Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equation.~\par
  \(\Dot{V}(x)=-q(x)-(k-\frac{1}{4})\frac{\partial{v}}{\partial{x}}G(x)R^{-1}(x)G^T(x)(\frac{\partial{V}}{\partial{x}})^T\)~\par
  \begin{enumerate}
  \item {if \(q(x)\)is positive definite and \(k\ge1/4\), we conclude that \(\Dot{V}(x)\)is negative definite; hence, the origin is asymptotically stable.
  }

  \item{if \(q(x)\)is only negative semidefinite and \(k>1/4\), we can only conclude that \(\Dot{V}(x)\)is negative semidefinite. But
  }

  \end{enumerate}
}

\problem{

A problem without subtasks

}

\problem{~\par

  A problem without subtasks beginning in a new line

}
